intro: Gymnandra elongata, commonly known as the slender gymnandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Gymnandra elongata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
